channel.title: Programming on Corner case
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on Corner case

item.title: Verify Binary Search result with duplicate target in the array
NameCheck of XML Validation
item.description: The beautiful part is build up a array with size 2^16, each value is 8bits, each bit indicate something like whether current character could be start of name, valid name. For instance, number 4 is at 0x34 (decimal 52), so flags[52] = 0x0b (00001100), those 8bits 0/1 are indication. Chapter 5 of has the detail.

item.title: Tail Call Optimization
item.description: A tail call is a subroutine call which is followed by a return to the calling code. Tail calls are often optimized by interpreters and compilers of functional programming languages to more efficient forms of iteration. See here and here.

item.title: Quotes from Pragmatic Programming
item.description: Tip4: Don’t live with Broken Windows “….You may be thinking that no one has the time to go around cleaning up all the broken glass of a project. If you continue to think like that, then you’d better plan on getting a dumpster, or moving to another neighborhood. Don’t let entropy win.” Tip5: Be a catalyst for Change [The stone soup story] Basically I think I experience the negative thing which is described in the Tip4.
